messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
Update the phone number of the last person I sent a message to to +10293847563
Could you let me know who that contact is—either their name or person_id—so I can update the correct entry?
I don't have more info, sorry.
I’m sorry, but I need to know which contact to update. Do you recall their name or person_id (or any part of it) so I can make sure I update the right entry?
I only know it was the last person I sent a message to.

I’m not sure which contact to update without at least a name or ID. If you don’t have that, I can pull in your full contact list so you can pick the right person. Would you like me to list all your contacts for you to choose from?

messages.name: search_contacts
messages.content: ValueError: No search criteria are given. At least one search criteria should be provided among ('person_id', 'name', 'phone_number', 'relationship', 'is_self')

I can’t pull in your entire address book without any filter—our search requires at least one criterion. Could you give me something to search by? For example, any part of their name, an area code or substring of their phone number, or their relationship label.
I really don't have anything else to go on.

I’m afraid I can’t target a single contact without at least one identifier (name, part of their number, relationship, etc.). The best next step is for you to check your messaging app’s sent history, note the name or number of that last contact, then let me know—then I can update their entry.
